channel.title: Site
channel.description:
[size=2em][b]<EDIT>[/b][/size]
[size=2em][b]Ok, so I worked on the site some more, took the advice of using percentages, and now, I need to know how it looks like, my laptop has only 2 resolutions, so please visit the site and comment a screeny THANK YOU VERY MUCH:[/b][/size]
[size=2em][b][url=http://WWW.VREG.COMLI.COM]WWW.VREG.COMLI.COM[/url][/b][/size]
[b][size=3]P.S. This is not the ending site, I have to do some more work on the layout + I know the background of the clock doesn't match the background of the site but I'm working on that aswell.[/size] [/b] [size=x-large][b]</EDIT>[/b][/size]
Ok guys, I've recently learned some css and my friend told some guy that I can make website's so he asked me to make one for his company for about 300 dollars. Now I'm still working on it but there's a little problem, my css knowledge isn't soo good yet so the site doesn't appear the same on different computers. So I though you guys might be able to help me out, please visit [url=http://www.mparent.be]www.mparent.be[/url] and post me a print screen. THANK YOU VERY MUCH! I need to know how it looks on different computers.

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:26, topic:393438”]People want the “doodads” instead of something that is smooth and good flowing.[/quote]Only the unprofessional sites that wont get a lot of traffic think this, hence why when you are going to design for sites that actually pay a lot of money, adding ‘doodads’ doesn’t work. It’s basically just unprofessional on both sides

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:26, topic:393438”]Kind of funny though, those who don’t know anything about design etc. They don’t care how much it will cost( a lot of times it is hard for them to even think of a price. Takes a lot of researching.)

You are going to get a lot of business afterwards as well, even well nobody knows that this could run a lot smoother without the widgets and stuff. People want the “doodads” instead of something that is smooth and good flowing.[/quote]+1

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Kind of funny though, those who don’t know anything about design etc. They don’t care how much it will cost( a lot of times it is hard for them to even think of a price. Takes a lot of researching.)

You are going to get a lot of business afterwards as well, even well nobody knows that this could run a lot smoother without the widgets and stuff. People want the “doodads” instead of something that is smooth and good flowing.

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:21, topic:393438”]Get rid of the “widgets”. Most people are generally annoyed with them. I don’t care what the temperature is in Antwerp, and my system clock tells me the time, and date. The hit counter should be only that. A hit counter. I don’t care about anyone’s IP Address. It can also be reduced to a single number, which might be stored in an SQL table/column that auto increments. Or you can have another site take care of that for you.[/quote]As much as I agree, that is what I suggested my client. I told him a website does not need any widgets, keep it simple. But he said no, I want to have widgets and everything in it. Customer is king so I can’t tell him no. In the end it’s his website not mine. Also, he told me that he told a lot of people about me and that I will get a lot of offers after I finished his site so that’s awesome. @Muroth, my friend told that guy that he had a friend that knew a lot about computers including web development so he contacted me. And about the weather in Antwerp, he asked for that. And about the hit counter, I don’t care if it shows IP’s or not. It’s prettay.

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

For starters you should use position absolute for the boxes.

Reason; When you make the website smaller or the window of the browser, the boxes get resized automatic therefor things will hang outside.

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

http://www.website-hit-counters.com/
Is it just the bandwidth being slow on the site or do you just have a ton of stuff loading? It looks decent enough… How’d you get into this deal anyhow? I want to start selling my site designs to people who need it

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:15, topic:393438”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=490610.msg3590976#msg3590976 date=1304634146]

[quote author=Spencer4678 link=topic=490610.msg3590950#msg3590950 date=1304632854]Davidi2: It only shows your IP, not others…
[/quote]No, it shows yours and the two people that visited before you
[/quote]What Davidi said, but that’s the only decent hit counter I could find.

P.S. Mitko, what OS are you using?[/quote]Ubuntu, with Firefox 4

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Get rid of the “widgets”. Most people are generally annoyed with them. I don’t care what the temperature is in Antwerp, and my system clock tells me the time, and date. The hit counter should be only that. A hit counter. I don’t care about anyone’s IP Address. It can also be reduced to a single number, which might be stored in an SQL table/column that auto increments. Or you can have another site take care of that for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:19, topic:393438”]The load time of your page is still horrible. Why don’t you try using a smaller image for the background and repeating it?

body	{
			background-image: url(urltofile);
			background-repeat: repeat-x;
	}

and use the image that I attached.

It will look just slightly different from your current background but you will drop the background file size from 326KB to 1.8KB. Think of the massive difference that will make on a 56K dial-up connection. You go from a 5.8 second download time (for just the background image!) to a .03 second load time.[/quote]Thanks man, I was actully planning to do so. Thanks for the suggestion. I’m going to get some sleep now, its 5 am.

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

The load time of your page is still horrible. Why don’t you try using a smaller image for the background and repeating it?

body	{
			background-image: url(urltofile);
			background-repeat: repeat-x;
	}

and use the image that I attached.

It will look just slightly different from your current background but you will drop the background file size from 326KB to 1.8KB. Think of the massive difference that will make on a 56K dial-up connection. You go from a 5.8 second download time (for just the background image!) to a .03 second load time.

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:17, topic:393438”]looks nice, better than i can do right now at least the design part. i was wondering if u have looked into html5 and css3. jw b/c u can do some pretty cool things with both those.[/quote]TBH, I learned CSS about 2 weeks ago from the internet and I worked hard to get what I got atm. Maybe I’ll take a look at those langs when I’m advanced in atleast CSS and XHTML 1.1. P.S. I’m more of a flash guy. If I had to make a site in flash, damn, I would make something E-VIL but my client asked for a standard website.

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:16, topic:393438”]600 x 800 looks really good. Maybe need to decrease the images a litte bit or however you would do it.[/quote]screeny please?

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

Guys, as I stated above the site is NOT finished, I was planning to make the footer at the bottom and some other adjustments to make it look better.

Also, thanks to everyone who posted a screeny.

And, the thing is with that extra space to the right, basicly there’s a navigation bar and in there are the navigation buttons. Every button get’s stretched one pixel to the right and get’s a solid vertical line that represents the brakes between the buttons. Now, because of that I can’t match the size of that navigation bar and the navigation buttons, because of those 4 extra pixels. That is what is causing that effect. But as I wrote the last sentence I just figured out how to fix it, basicly my CSS tells the navigation buttons to use nav.gif. That image is 1/16th of the actual buttons so I asked CSS to repeat in x. But what if I didn’t do that and made the nav.gif the exact size of those buttons and putted the brake in the actual background. So that would mean I don’t have to use the extra pixel and that means problem sovled!!! THANK YOU MOPAR

Read full topic

item.title: Site
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:5, topic:393438”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=490610.msg3587326#msg3587326 date=1304288014]
Here’s it viewed in a 1600x900 (so 16:9) resolution.

Tip: if you’re not already doing so, always use percentages for widths as opposed to pixels, this prevents it going completed fucked when you zoom in or out.
Also, design a favicon.
[/quote]Thanks man, favicon and percentages, not sure you can use percentages with css though.[/quote]

Yes you can lol…
